segments.text: You haven't spent much time with Sophia lately . Are you speaking to each other at the moment ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , we're not . We've been drifting apart for a while .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But you two used to do everything together . I thought you really enjoyed each other's company .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We did , but since she started her new job , all she does is hang out with her new friends from work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Can't you hang out with them , too ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I could , but all they ever talk about is work , so I always end up feeling left out .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Maybe you should invite her over for dinner , so it's just the two of you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I tried that a few weeks ago and she ended bringing a pal from work with her ! She's so busy these days that it's just impossible to hang out with her .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It can't be that bad . She was always a really good friend to you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You're right . She would never talk about me behind my back or hold a grudge . But she just doesn't seem very interested in our friendship anymore .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: She's probably just excited about her new job . You should give her some time . It would be a shame to lose such a good friend .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've given her enough time . I'm over it now .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I still think you two should try to patch things up .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think I just have to accept the fact that it's time for us to go our separate ways .
segments.speaker: S2
